title: Includes possession of four or more stolen bicycles in the crime of criminal possession of stolen property in the fourth degree
summary: Includes possession of four or more stolen bicycles in the crime of criminal possession of stolen property in the fourth degree
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                          257

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                      (PREFILED)

                                    January 5, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M.  of A. HEVESI, LENTOL, LAVINE, ZEBROWSKI, CYMBROWITZ,
         PERRY, HOYT,  BRENNAN,  PHEFFER,  COOK,  BENEDETTO,  JAFFEE,  MILLMAN,
         M. MILLER,  ABBATE, CASTRO, TITONE, BOYLAND, DESTITO, MAISEL -- Multi-
         Sponsored by -- M.  of  A.  AMEDORE,  BOYLE,  CUSICK,  GLICK,  HIKIND,
         MARKEY,  MAYERSOHN,  MENG,  PRETLOW,  REILLY, TOBACCO -- read once and
         referred to the Committee on Codes

       AN ACT to amend the  penal  law,  relating  to  the  crime  of  criminal
         possession  of  stolen  property in the fourth degree where the stolen
         property consists of four or more bicycles

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1. Section 165.45 of the penal law is amended by adding a new
    2  subdivision 8 to read as follows:
    3    8. THE PROPERTY CONSISTS OF FOUR OR MORE BICYCLES.
    4    S 2. This act shall take effect on the first of November next succeed-
    5  ing the date on which it shall have become a law.





        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD01559-01-1
actClause: AN ACT to amend the penal law, relating to the crime of criminal possession of stolen property in the fourth degree where the stolen property consists of four or more bicycles
